page.title: 13MOUNTAIN TRIATHLON,LOWESWATR
page.content: In 1983 the first Slalom Lager M.T.was promoted by Matthew Brown Brewery & is now the premier British Triathlon event, unique in its use of natural resources. In 1985 competitors came from Australia, Austria, Sweden & U.S.A. 70-80 entrants of mixed ages and sex (8-10 females), run one mile from the Village Hall to Loweswater lakeshore then swim 3/4 mile across widest part & back. They run back to start, cycle into Lorton Valley, over Whinlatter Pass to Braithwaite, along Borrowdale Valley to Seathwaite (19 m) The run starts & entrants check in at Sty Head Pass, Scafell Pike and Esk House before descending to Seathwaite. Cycles are collected for the last ride over Honnister Pass to Buttermere and back to Loweswater. The winning times were just under 4 hours (male) & just over 5 hours (female).
